channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Who sued Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth this week? Find out in the quiz
item.description: This week, you'll need to be knowledgeable about holy media darlings, portrait-making techniques, and beloved Canadian icons — and that's just three q...

item.title: NPR battles Trump executive order in court
item.description: NPR was in court for a pivotal hearing arguing that the Trump administration had broken the law with its treatment of public media.

item.title: Traffic congestion hits a record high, spreading to more hours of the week
item.description: If it seems like traffic is getting worse where you live, that's because it probably is. After dropping during the COVID-19 pandemic, congestion climb...

item.title: The World Cup draw is here. Here's why it matters — and how it will work
item.description: FIFA is about to determine which teams all 48 participating countries in the FIFA World Cup 2026 will face in the group phase of the tournament, which...

item.title: China in diplomatic push to isolate Japan in feud over Taiwan issue
item.description: No end in sight to spat between Japan and China over Taiwan, as neither Tokyo nor Beijing shows signs of backing down.

item.title: Endangered jaguar spotted at watering hole in Arizona
item.description: Officials have said that jaguar breeding in the U.S. has not been documented in more than a century.

item.title: 12/4: CBS Evening News
item.description: Luigi Mangione arrest video played in court as defense fights evidence; $1.6 million raised for 88-year-old man working at grocery store

item.title: Shops empty in a Hispanic neighborhood as immigration crackdown comes to Louisiana
item.description: Federal border agents have descended on a Hispanic enclave just outside New Orleans and local business owners are suffering.

item.title: Trump hails 'historic' peace deal between DR Congo and Rwanda
item.description: The US president hopes that a peace deal will pave the way for greater American investment in the resource-rich region.

item.title: India travel chaos worsens as IndiGo cancels hundreds of flights
item.description: IndiGo, India's largest carrier, has said operations will return to full normalcy only by 10 February.

item.title: Germany votes to bring back voluntary military service programme for 18-year-olds
item.description: The shift in its approach to its military follows a push to create Europe's strongest conventional army.

item.title: $20,000 Faberge egg recovered after man allegedly swallowed it
item.description: The special edition locket was inspired by the James Bond film "Octopussy," which revolves around a plot to steal a rare Faberge egg.

item.title: Jasmine Crockett called Texas Senate race contenders as she weighs jumping into fray
item.description: As intrigue grows over whether Texas Democratic Rep. Jasmine Crockett plans to announce a U.S. Senate campaign next week, she confirmed to CBS News sh...

item.title: Netflix reportedly closes in on Warner Bros deal
item.description: The streaming giant has emerged as the top bidder ahead of rivals Comcast and Paramount Skydance, reports say.

item.title: Kenya signs landmark health deal with US despite data fears
item.description: Kenya becomes the first African country to secure US health funding since cuts to foreign aid by Trump.

item.title: 12/4: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Lawmakers see video of second strike on alleged drug boat; Congressional members share their Spotify wrapped playlists.

item.title: Immigration crackdown in New Orleans has a target of 5,000 arrests. Is that possible?
Man accused of planting pipe bombs before Jan. 6 Capitol attack is charged with explosives offenses
